title: Logo
text:
What is Logo?


Logo is a programming language known because it produces images created by a small turtle.

title: Logo
text:
Basic commands


At the beginning the turtle is positioned at the centre of the screen.

title: Logo
text:
How to draw a square?


The turtle can move forward and draw a line using the command forward or its short form fd:



forward 100

title: Logo
text:
How to draw a square?


Now we need to turn the turtle 90 degrees:


right 90

title: Logo
text:
How to draw a square?


Let’s move forward:


forward 100

title: Logo
text:
How to draw a square?


And turn right again …


right 90

title: Logo
text:
How to draw a square?


you know what’s next already


forward 100

title: Logo
text:
How to draw a square?


Let’s turn the turtle one last time


right 90

title: Logo
text:
How to draw a square?


We did it!!


forward 100

title: Logo
text:
Loops
A loop is an instruction that repeats until a specified condition is reached. In Logo, the most common loop operations is called repeat.

title: Logo
text:
A square using loops


This is a square can be created using repeat:
repeat 4 [
    forward 100
    right 90
]

title: Logo
text:
Another example of loops
This is a star of 10 points created repeating the same code 10 times.


repeat 10 [
    forward 30
    right -100
    forward 30
    right 140
]

title: Logo
text:
More basic commands



Command
Abbrv
Description




forward
fd
Moves forward


back
bk
Moves backward


right
rt
Turn x degrees to the right


left
lt
Turn x degrees to the left


home

Go back to start

title: Logo
text:
More basic commands



Command
Abbrv
Description




clearscreen
cs
Clean the screen


hideturtle
ht
Hide the turtle


showturtle
st
Show the turtle


penup
pu
Put the pen into non-draw state


pendown
pd
Put the pen into draw state


setpensize

Set the line thickness


setpencolor

Change the line color

title: Logo
text:
More advanced commands



Command
Description




repeat



arc angle radious
Draw an arc


setpos [X Y]
Move the turtle to position X,Y
